creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta G. Simmons
text: The Mangal are a nomadic group inhabiting border areas in the east Afghanistan/west Pakistan region. Although their embroidery reveals the influence of other communities in both countries, this veil, with its high degree of abstraction, appears to be uniquely Mangal.  "Wrong-sided" stitching along one edge shows where the veil was folded back to frame the wearer's face with an embroidered border of triangular design.
title: Woman's veil (chadar)
